commitResults.messageTitle: Level-1 add Fideline.java edited Duke.java to employ Fideline bot
Level-2 added list function tweaked some responses
Level-3 added ability to mark/unmark tasks added Task.java, TaskManager.java
Level-4 Task.java change to abstract class with 3 new child classes: Todo.java, Deadline.java, Event.java User is now able to created 3 types of tasks

Level-4 Task.java change to abstract class with 3 new child classes: Todo.java, Deadline.java, Event.java User is now able to created 3 types of tasks This commit was supposed to be part of the previous one
added first test case (creation of tasks + marking/unmarking functionality)

Level-5 currently handling syntax errors for deadline, event command wrong type of argument error for mark and unmark command (not int) no argument error for todo, deadline, event, mark, unmark command invalid command error

added InputParser.java to handle and parse user input
added custom InputError.java that is to be throw when user input is invalid

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-6 added deletion command to delete existing tasks

commitResults.messageBody:
Task data is lost after program ends.

Let's store all task data locally.

Task data can be accessed during later sessions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update deadline parser to recognize dates
commitResults.messageBody:
Deadline task's deadlines are stored exclusively as strings.

Program is unable to make sense of the timing of deadlines.

Let's update the parser to detect deadline tasks created with
a deadline following the format "dd/mm/yyyy" and store deadlines
as dates.

Dates can be expressed more intuitively by the system. Features that
compare the deadlines of tasks can be added in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Deadline, Event, Fideline class: fix message spacing

commitResults.messageBody:
Fideline and Inputparser files are densely packed and hard to read.

Code is difficult to read and edit.

Let's organize the code in a more readable fashion, following OOP
closely. More classes are created for better organization.

Code becomes more organized with greater standardization.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bugs relating to saving and reading saved data

commitResults.messageBody:
Let's use Gradle and JUnit to automate and aid in the building of this
project.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add javadoc to a few classes
Tweak the code to comply with coding standards
Add find command allowing user to find tasks using keywords.
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's add a find command that can provide a list of all existing tasks
that contain a specific keyword in their description.

Fideline employs a text-based UI.

Expression is limited and it is not very user-friendly.

Let's implement GUI for Fideline.

Fideline's user-friendliness can be enhanced through this format.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix dialog box cutting off long text

commitResults.messageBody:
Code is hard to read in some areas and the quality can be improved in
most files.

Code is difficult to read and edit.

Let's improve the quality of the code, paying close attention to
SLAP, guard clauses and avoiding arrowheads.

Code becomes more organized with greater standardization.
Let's add assertions to improve code security while edits are made.

commitResults.messageTitle: Check if new task proposed already exists in the task list
commitResults.messageBody:
Duplicate tasks are not accounted for.

User can accidentally create the same task twice.

Let's prevent the user from creating duplicate tasks, throwing an
exception if the new task already exists in the task list.

(C-DetectDuplicates)

commitResults.messageTitle: Add user guide to the readme.md

commitResults.messageBody:
Let's include quick start portion to the user guide so that new users
will know how to start the program using a .jar file
